holidays.name: Pretend To Be A Time Traveler Day
holidays.description: A quirky day where people are encouraged to dress, talk, and act like they’ve traveled from a different era—past or future. It’s a fun way to spark creativity and imaginings about time travel!
holidays.origin: Unofficial, born from online communities and time travel fiction fandoms celebrating their favorite sci-fi themes.
holidays.funFact: Some participants even write elaborate backstories for their time traveler persona, blending humor and history.

holidays.name: Festivus
holidays.description: An alternative holiday invented as a satirical take on holiday traditions, featuring the infamous 'Airing of Grievances' and 'Feats of Strength'.
holidays.origin: Created by writer Dan O'Keefe and popularized by the TV show Seinfeld in the 1990s.
holidays.funFact: Festivus is celebrated on December 23rd, but fans often start festivities early, including December 8, to stretch out the fun!

holidays.name: National Brownie Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to celebrating the beloved chocolatey baked treat known as the brownie.
holidays.origin: Origin unclear, but it’s been a popular unofficial food holiday celebrated by dessert fans across the U.S.
holidays.funFact: The first known brownie recipe was published in the late 19th century, and National Brownie Day invites everyone to enjoy creative brownie variations!

holidays.name: Bicycle Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the first intentional LSD trip by Albert Hofmann on April 19, 1943, famously experienced while riding his bicycle home – but some communities observe quirky related events on December 8 as an offbeat celebration.
holidays.origin: Marked by psychedelic culture and enthusiasts of Hofmann's work.
holidays.funFact: Hofmann’s bicycle ride is considered a landmark in the history of psychedelics and counterculture.
